channel.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks
channel.description:
[size=36pt]PROBLEM SOLVED THANKS TO "ultimatepkvillage" AND "Daginith"[/size]
Hi, Ive got a Rsps running and everything is working/ Ive connected to it from my public library. The problem I'm having is some of my friends are receiving "Cannot find javaw" when attempting to run the client. " I'm talking about run.bat to start the server."
[b]This is the run.bat[/b] [i]@echo off start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit[/i]
things I have tried. 1.) re-installed java and jdk to friends cpu 2.) changed file locations of friends cpu of the javaw.exe file 3.) re-installed the client 4.) restarted friends laptop and other's friends cpu 5.) changing 'javaw' to 'java' ~[b]tip from Daginith[/b] 6.) Adding a full path to the run.bat ~[b]tip from Daginith[/b]
This should be easy for me, but i cant seem to figure it out.

item.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

your welcome!

item.source: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks

item.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @HandgunSally HandgunSally
item.description:
@HandgunSally wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:7, topic:437225”]something like this mate

@echo off "C:\Program Files(x86)\java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui pause
make sure that they have jdk1.7.0_03 in the Program Files (x86) Folder, Java Folder if they dont and have other java version change it or try the Program Files Folder, Java Folder.

Also they might need to setup their environmental variables

Put the variable values under the one that says User variables for (LOGIN USER) but remember to change it to whatever java version they have from the program file folders/ java folders

CLASSPATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

PATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin;

If help needed I have Teamviewer & Skype: Oceannomic[/quote]

Thanks got them both fixed, i really appreciate your help!

Read full topic
item.source: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks

item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

something like this mate

@echo off "C:\Program Files(x86)\java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui pause
make sure that they have jdk1.7.0_03 in the Program Files (x86) Folder, Java Folder if they dont and have other java version change it or try the Program Files Folder, Java Folder.

Also they might need to setup their environmental variables

Put the variable values under the one that says User variables for (LOGIN USER) but remember to change it to whatever java version they have from the program file folders/ java folders

CLASSPATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

PATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin;

If help needed I have Teamviewer & Skype: Oceannomic

Read full topic

item.source: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks

item.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @HandgunSally HandgunSally
item.description:
@HandgunSally wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:4, topic:437225”]then put the full path of the java in quotes

“C://programs/program files/java/jre7/java.exe”

This isnt the exact path, seeing as i use Linux, and i forgot how the Windows file system is set up. Just find your java.exe and and put the full path in quotes, in place of the word ‘java’ in the .bat[/quote]

Note: I edited both friends run.bat file twice this time.


Friend with laptop
@echo off
C:\Programfiles\java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

Friend with PC
@echo off
C:\Programfiles(x86)\java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

unfortunately both had same errors as last time
"C:\Program is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable or batch file.

I took java courses in community college and i was tought to use the “start” command so i tried that again,

Friends laptop
@echo off
start C:\Programfiles\java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

Friend with PC
@echo off
start C:\Programfiles(x86)\java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

Both new run.bat files returned
Windows cannot find the c:\Program, make sure you type the name correctly then try again"

Took a while testing 2 different computers and methods sorry I really appreciate all help thus far!

Read full topic
item.source: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks

item.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

then put the full path of the java in quotes

“C://programs/program files/java/jre7/java.exe”

This isnt the exact path, seeing as i use Linux, and i forgot how the Windows file system is set up. Just find your java.exe and and put the full path in quotes, in place of the word ‘java’ in the .bat

Read full topic
item.source: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks

item.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @HandgunSally HandgunSally
item.description:
@HandgunSally wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:2, topic:437225”]try changing ‘javaw’ to ‘java’

also take out the ‘start’ i don’t see what it is doing there.[/quote]

Thanks for super fast reply!

I edited the run.bat file to look like this.
@echo off
java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

Error
Java is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

I cant believe im having such a hard time with this… I am sorry Moparscape forums I’m officially ashamed =S

Read full topic

Hi,
